intro: Camellia psilocarpa, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Philippines, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can be pink, white, or red. The plant has broad, glossy leaves and produces fruit that contains seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its cultural and ecological significance, it is also considered a conservation concern in its native habitat.
